intro: Deyeuxia parsana, commonly known as the slender false rice, is a perennial grass species native to parts of Asia. It typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, showcasing its adaptability to moist environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its botanical features include hollow stems and a fibrous root system, which are characteristic of the Poaceae family. Deyeuxia parsana is often found in wetlands and is used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil.
